eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.connectors.http

Class RestAgentConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.connectors.AgentConnector
      • eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.connectors.http.RestAgentConnector

  • public class RestAgentConnector
extends AgentConnector
    Implementation of an AgentConnector based on HTTP REST services. This connector uses Restlet framework to deliver requests to an Agent component specified in the configuration file.
    Author:
    sulfo

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.lang.String AGENT_API_STRING
      The name of the Agent API, this string usually follows the IP and port.
      private java.lang.String agentServiceUrl
      This is the agent service URL, without attributes (basically something like http://ip:port/apiname) .

      Name of the configuration parameter for whether the REST Agent Connector uses simulated calls (such configuration is useful during debugging, when no real REST Agent is available or operational and connectivity of this OGWAPI needs to be tested).

      Name of the configuration parameter for Agent IP.

      Name of the configuration parameter for whether Agent utilises HTTPS or HTTP.

      Configuration flag for using dummy operations instead of the real ones.

    • Field Detail

      • PARAM_SOURCEOID

        private static final java.lang.String PARAM_SOURCEOID
        Reserved word for source OID parameter. Since it is impossible to incorporate the source object ID into the request other way than in parameters (without changing the request body), one parameter with this name is reserved and the source object ID is sent as its value. If there was a parameter with the same name before, it will get overwritten.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONFIG_PARAM_CONNECTORRESTDUMMY

        private static final java.lang.String CONFIG_PARAM_CONNECTORRESTDUMMY
        Name of the configuration parameter for whether the REST Agent Connector uses simulated calls (such configuration is useful during debugging, when no real REST Agent is available or operational and connectivity of this OGWAPI needs to be tested).
        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • RestAgentConnector

        public RestAgentConnector(org.apache.commons.configuration2.XMLConfiguration config,
                          java.util.logging.Logger logger)
        Constructor. It is necessary to provide all parameters. If null is provided in place of any of them, a storm of null pointer exceptions is imminent.
        Parameters:
        config - Configuration of the OGWAPI.
        logger - Logger of the OGWAPI.

      • forwardEventToObject

        public NetworkMessageResponse forwardEventToObject(java.lang.String sourceOid,
                                                   java.lang.String destinationOid,
                                                   java.lang.String eventId,
                                                   java.lang.String body,
                                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Description copied from class: AgentConnector
        This method gets executed when an event belonging to local object ID is received and needs to be forwarded to its respective device.
        Specified by:
        forwardEventToObject in class AgentConnector
        Parameters:
        sourceOid - The object ID that published the event.
        destinationOid - Subscriber object ID.
        eventId - ID of the event channel.
        body - Body of the event.
        parameters - Any parameters that were inserted into the event.
        Returns:
        Response. See the main documentation for this class on how to create and fill the object.

      • assembleAgentServiceUrl

        private java.lang.String assembleAgentServiceUrl()
        This method takes incoming request and parses it into URL of an Agent service. See the main Javadoc section for the request class for more details.

      • performOperation

        private NetworkMessageResponse performOperation(byte operationCode,
                                                java.lang.String sourceOid,
                                                java.lang.String fullUrl,
                                                java.lang.String body,
                                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Processes the request that arrived from the network. After the URL of the required Agent service is assembled, the URL is called with the necessary HTTP method and the result is returned.
        Parameters:
        operationCode - Code of the HTTP operation, see the constants.
        sourceOid - The object ID of the source.
        fullUrl - Full URL of the Agent's endpoint to be reached.
        body - Body of the request.
        parameters - Parameters passed in the request.
        Returns:
        Response message with the results.

      • performDummyOperation

        private NetworkMessageResponse performDummyOperation(byte operationCode,
                                                     java.lang.String sourceOid,
                                                     java.lang.String fullUrl,
                                                     java.lang.String body,
                                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Very handy testing method that, if set in the configuration file, can be used instead of performOperation. This one does not rely on functional agent and always returns positive results.
        Parameters:
        operationCode - Code of the HTTP operation, see the constants.
        sourceOid - The object ID of the source.
        fullUrl - Full URL of the Agent's end point to be reached.
        body - Body of the request.
        parameters - Parameters passed in the request.
        Returns:
        Response message with the results.
